    • Constructor Detail

      • HostAddress

        public HostAddress(String fqdn,
                   int port,
                   List<InetAddress> inetAddresses)
        Creates a new HostAddress with the given FQDN.
        Parameters:
        fqdn - the optional fully qualified domain name (FQDN).
        port - The port to connect on.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the port is out of valid range (0 - 65535).

      • HostAddress

        public HostAddress(int port,
                   InetAddress hostAddress)

      • HostAddress

        public HostAddress(String fqdn,
                   Exception e)
        Constructs a new failed HostAddress. This constructor is usually used when the DNS resolution of the domain name failed for some reason.
        Parameters:
        fqdn - the domain name of the host.
        e - the exception causing the failure.

      • getExceptions

        public Map<InetAddress,Exception> getExceptions()
        Retrieve the Exception that caused a connection failure to this HostAddress. Every HostAddress found in SmackException.ConnectionException will have an Exception set, which can be retrieved with this method.
        Returns:
        the Exception causing this HostAddress to fail
